intro: Cucullaria rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are round or heart-shaped, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that releases seeds when mature.
